title: Response Time: Vol. 41
description: In our latest ‚ÄúResponse Time‚Äù interview, we ask Ehsan Rishat, Head of Customer Success at REsimpli, about his greatest productivity hack, the most valuable thing about working in support, and more.
author: Kate Sugrue
excerpt: We ask Ehsan Rishat, Head of Customer Success at REsimpli, about the most valuable thing about working in customer service, and more.
text: Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom @KateSugrue You satisfy your customers, but can you satisfy our curiosity? With Ehsan Rishat, Head of Customer Success at REsimpli. Please tell us a little bit about your company and what you do there. At REsimpli, we‚Äôre all about making life easier for real estate investors. We provide the tools they need to scale efficiently, close more deals, and focus on what really matters. As the Head of Customer Success, I get to connect our product‚Äôs potential with our customers‚Äô goals. What word or phrase in customer service jargon should be retired? ‚ÄúLet me reach out to the backend.‚Äù It makes it sound like there‚Äôs a huge divide between the customer service team and the technical team ‚Äì like we‚Äôre passing the buck. Which celebrity would be really great at your job, and why? Keanu Reeves, hands down. He‚Äôs cool under pressure, incredibly humble, and always puts others at ease. Plus, his calm and collected vibe would be perfect for handling tricky customer situations with grace. What‚Äôs the most valuable thing that working in customer service has taught you? It‚Äôs taught me that empathy and patience can work wonders. Even the toughest situations can turn into trust-building moments if you approach them with care and understanding. It‚Äôs not just about fixing problems ‚Äì it‚Äôs about showing customers they matter. Describe the essence of great customer service using only three words. Listen, solve, delight. Which movie robot would you choose as your AI sidekick, and why? Baymax from Big Hero 6. He‚Äôs smart, resourceful, and deeply empathetic ‚Äì everything you want in a sidekick. Plus, who wouldn‚Äôt want a robot that can solve problems and give big warm hugs when needed? What can you do that a bot will never be able to replicate? Connecting with people on a personal, emotional level. Bots can provide answers, but they can‚Äôt celebrate a customer‚Äôs success or genuinely empathize with their frustrations. Those human moments are where the magic happens. Do you identify more with the title ‚Äúcustomer support,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer service,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer success,‚Äù or ‚Äúcustomer experience,‚Äù and why? I identify most with ‚Äúcustomer success‚Äù because it‚Äôs all about being proactive. It‚Äôs not just about solving problems but about helping customers achieve their goals and get the most out of our tools. It‚Äôs a mindset shift from reactive to impactful. What‚Äôs the one piece of advice you would give to your peers in the customer service industry? Track your team‚Äôs performance and celebrate their wins. Recognizing achievements ‚Äì big or small ‚Äì keeps your team motivated and engaged, and that positivity translates directly into better customer experiences. A happy team that feels valued will always go the extra mile for your customers! What‚Äôs your greatest productivity hack? Time blocking for specific tasks is my secret weapon. By dedicating focused time slots for emails, project planning, and team check-ins, I can get more done and stay sharp throughout the day. What book are you reading at the moment? The 80/20 Principle by Richard Koch. It‚Äôs a fantastic deep dive into how 20% of efforts often drive 80% of results. It‚Äôs changed how I prioritize everything ‚Äì focusing on what truly makes an impact instead of getting stuck in busy work. What‚Äôs the best thing a customer has ever said to you? One of our customer support agents, Jay, received this feedback recently, and it really stuck with me: ‚ÄúJay was great ‚Äì super helpful and ready to bring the solutions I was looking for. [They] went above and beyond to make sure everything was resolved. The support REsimpli has is unmatched!‚Äù Hearing something like this reminds us why we love what we do ‚Äì creating experiences that truly make a difference. What gif best describes your mental state right now? Where do you get your support leadership news? I‚Äôm a big fan of CSM Practice newsletters by Irit Eizips. Her insights into customer success strategies and leadership are incredibly practical and always relevant. They‚Äôve helped me refine how we deliver value and stay ahead of industry trends. What do you wish people knew about working in customer service? It‚Äôs one of the most creative and rewarding roles out there. You‚Äôre not just answering questions ‚Äì you‚Äôre solving puzzles, building relationships, and shaping how customers see your company. It‚Äôs a dynamic mix of strategy, empathy, and execution. If you wrote a book about your experiences in customer service, what would the title be? ‚ÄúGuiding with Value: How Customer Support Drives Smart Decisions.‚Äù The book would focus on how support isn‚Äôt just about fixing issues ‚Äì it‚Äôs about guiding customers toward smarter choices, building trust, and ensuring their success every step of the way. What‚Äôs the strangest thing a customer has asked you? Someone once dropped into our live chat and casually asked, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your churn percentage?‚Äù They might‚Äôve been curious, a competitor, or just trying to keep me on my toes! What‚Äôs your most used emoji in customer chats? üôå because it‚Äôs perfect for celebrating wins, big or small. Whether it‚Äôs a customer closing a deal or resolving a tricky issue, it‚Äôs my go-to for spreading positivity! Conversation closed‚Ä¶ for now üòè If you‚Äôre interested in being featured in our¬†Response Time series, you can share your insights on customer service ‚Äì and what your greatest productivity hack is ‚Äì with us here. Customer Service 2 min read Response Time: Vol. 40 In our latest ‚ÄúResponse Time‚Äù interview, we ask Kostas Sveronis, Technical Support Manager at Yodeck, about the essence of great customer service, and more. Kate Sugrue Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom Customer Service 3 min read Response Time: Vol. 39 In our latest ‚ÄúResponse Time‚Äù interview, we ask Sam Barrett, Head of Customer Experience at Runna, about how he goes the extra mile for customers, and more. Kate Sugrue Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom Customer Service 2 min read Response Time: Vol. 38 In our latest ‚ÄúResponse Time‚Äù interview, we ask Victor Salinas, Head of Customer Success at VMetrix, about what movie robot he‚Äôd choose as his AI sidekick, and more. Kate Sugrue Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom
html:
Senior Manager, Advocacy & Community Marketing, Intercom

@KateSugrue

You satisfy your customers, but can you satisfy our curiosity?

With Ehsan Rishat, Head of Customer Success at REsimpli.

Please tell us a little bit about your company and what you do there.
At REsimpli, we‚Äôre all about making life easier for real estate investors. We provide the tools they need to scale efficiently, close more deals, and focus on what really matters. As the Head of Customer Success, I get to connect our product‚Äôs potential with our customers‚Äô goals.

What word or phrase in customer service jargon should be retired?
‚ÄúLet me reach out to the backend.‚Äù It makes it sound like there‚Äôs a huge divide between the customer service team and the technical team ‚Äì like we‚Äôre passing the buck.

Which celebrity would be really great at your job, and why?
Keanu Reeves, hands down. He‚Äôs cool under pressure, incredibly humble, and always puts others at ease. Plus, his calm and collected vibe would be perfect for handling tricky customer situations with grace.

What‚Äôs the most valuable thing that working in customer service has taught you?
It‚Äôs taught me that empathy and patience can work wonders. Even the toughest situations can turn into trust-building moments if you approach them with care and understanding. It‚Äôs not just about fixing problems ‚Äì it‚Äôs about showing customers they matter.

Describe the essence of great customer service using only three words.
Listen, solve, delight.

Which movie robot would you choose as your AI sidekick, and why?
Baymax from Big Hero 6. He‚Äôs smart, resourceful, and deeply empathetic ‚Äì everything you want in a sidekick. Plus, who wouldn‚Äôt want a robot that can solve problems and give big warm hugs when needed?

What can you do that a bot will never be able to replicate?
Connecting with people on a personal, emotional level. Bots can provide answers, but they can‚Äôt celebrate a customer‚Äôs success or genuinely empathize with their frustrations. Those human moments are where the magic happens.

Do you identify more with the title ‚Äúcustomer support,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer service,‚Äù ‚Äúcustomer success,‚Äù or ‚Äúcustomer experience,‚Äù and why?
I identify most with ‚Äúcustomer success‚Äù because it‚Äôs all about being proactive. It‚Äôs not just about solving problems but about helping customers achieve their goals and get the most out of our tools. It‚Äôs a mindset shift from reactive to impactful.

What‚Äôs the one piece of advice you would give to your peers in the customer service industry?
Track your team‚Äôs performance and celebrate their wins. Recognizing achievements ‚Äì big or small ‚Äì keeps your team motivated and engaged, and that positivity translates directly into better customer experiences. A happy team that feels valued will always go the extra mile for your customers!

What‚Äôs your greatest productivity hack?
Time blocking for specific tasks is my secret weapon. By dedicating focused time slots for emails, project planning, and team check-ins, I can get more done and stay sharp throughout the day.

What book are you reading at the moment?
The 80/20 Principle by Richard Koch. It‚Äôs a fantastic deep dive into how 20% of efforts often drive 80% of results. It‚Äôs changed how I prioritize everything ‚Äì focusing on what truly makes an impact instead of getting stuck in busy work.

What‚Äôs the best thing a customer has ever said to you?
One of our customer support agents, Jay, received this feedback recently, and it really stuck with me: ‚ÄúJay was great ‚Äì super helpful and ready to bring the solutions I was looking for. [They] went above and beyond to make sure everything was resolved. The support REsimpli has is unmatched!‚Äù Hearing something like this reminds us why we love what we do ‚Äì creating experiences that truly make a difference.

What gif best describes your mental state right now?

Where do you get your support leadership news?
I‚Äôm a big fan of CSM Practice newsletters by Irit Eizips. Her insights into customer success strategies and leadership are incredibly practical and always relevant. They‚Äôve helped me refine how we deliver value and stay ahead of industry trends.

What do you wish people knew about working in customer service?
It‚Äôs one of the most creative and rewarding roles out there. You‚Äôre not just answering questions ‚Äì you‚Äôre solving puzzles, building relationships, and shaping how customers see your company. It‚Äôs a dynamic mix of strategy, empathy, and execution.

If you wrote a book about your experiences in customer service, what would the title be?
‚ÄúGuiding with Value: How Customer Support Drives Smart Decisions.‚Äù The book would focus on how support isn‚Äôt just about fixing issues ‚Äì it‚Äôs about guiding customers toward smarter choices, building trust, and ensuring their success every step of the way.

What‚Äôs the strangest thing a customer has asked you?
Someone once dropped into our live chat and casually asked, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your churn percentage?‚Äù They might‚Äôve been curious, a competitor, or just trying to keep me on my toes!

What‚Äôs your most used emoji in customer chats?
üôå because it‚Äôs perfect for celebrating wins, big or small. Whether it‚Äôs a customer closing a deal or resolving a tricky issue, it‚Äôs my go-to for spreading positivity!

Conversation closed‚Ä¶ for now üòè

If you‚Äôre interested in being featured in our¬†Response Time series, you can share your insights on customer service ‚Äì and what your greatest productivity hack is ‚Äì with us here.
